issues.description: The solution implementation declares private fields using snake_case (lecture_name, number_of_inscribed_students, etc.) while the problem statement’s UML and textual description specify camelCase field names (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors). This mismatch will prevent the reference solution from compiling and confuse students about the correct field names.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the private fields in the solution to use camelCase exactly as specified in the UML and problem text: lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors, and update all references accordingly.

issues.description: The solution repository’s Lecture class declares its core attributes using snake_case (lecture_name, number_of_inscribed_students, number_of_guest_students, number_of_lecturers, number_of_tutors) which conflicts with the camelCase names (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors) specified in the problem statement and implied in the template. Moreover, the constructor and methods refer to the camelCase fields that aren’t declared, creating confusion and a compilation error.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the field declarations in Lecture.java to use camelCase (lectureName, numberOfInscribedStudents, numberOfGuestStudents, numberOfLecturers, numberOfTutors) so they match the problem specification and the references in the constructor and methods.
